```{r}
southcarolina_demographics <-read.csv("C:/Users/stefa/OneDrive/Documents/Capstone/South Carolina Meta Ads Insights by Demographics 2022 - 2025.csv")
```

```{r}
sc_demographics_groups <- southcarolina_demographics %>% 
  filter(Age!="Unknown") %>% 
  filter(Gender != "unknown") %>% 
  group_by(Age, Gender) %>% 
  summarise(
    total_reach = sum(Reach, na.rm = TRUE),
    total_impressions = sum(Impressions, na.rm = TRUE),
    total_link_clicks = sum(LinkClicks, na.rm = TRUE),
    total_spend = sum(Spend)) %>% 
   mutate(CTR = (total_link_clicks / total_impressions) * 100)
```

```{r}
library(ggplot2)

ggplot(sc_demographics_groups, aes(x = Age, y = total_impressions, fill = Gender)) +
  geom_bar(stat = "identity", position = "dodge") +
  labs(title = "Impressions by Age and Gender", x = "Age Group", y = "Total Impressions") +
  theme_minimal() +
  scale_fill_brewer(palette = "Set1")
```
```{r}
ggplot(sc_demographics_groups, aes(x = Age, y = total_link_clicks, fill = Gender)) +
  geom_bar(stat = "identity", position = "dodge") +
  labs(title = "Link Clicks by Age and Gender", x = "Age Group", y = "Total Link Clicks") +
```

```{r}
sc_summarized_date_data <- southcarolina_demographics %>%
  filter(Gender %in% c("male", "female")) %>% 
   filter(Age != "Unknown") %>% 
  group_by(AdInsightsDate, Age, Gender) %>%
  summarise(total_impressions = sum(Impressions, na.rm = TRUE), .groups = "drop")

sc_summarized_date_data$AdInsightsDate <- as.Date(sc_summarized_date_data$AdInsightsDate)

ggplot(sc_summarized_date_data, aes(x = AdInsightsDate, y = total_impressions, 
                                       color = Gender, group = interaction(Age, Gender))) +
  geom_area(alpha = 0.4, position = "identity") +  
  geom_line() +  
  facet_grid(rows = vars(Age), cols = vars(Gender), scales = "fixed") + 
  labs(title = "Impressions Over Time by Age and Gender",
       x = "Date",
       y = "Total Impressions") +
  scale_x_date(date_breaks = "6 months", date_labels = "%b %Y") +  
  theme_minimal() +
  theme(axis.text.x = element_text(angle = 45, hjust = 1))

# Adjust plot size for R Markdown / Jupyter Notebook
options(repr.plot.width=12, repr.plot.height=6)
```

```{r}
print(unique(southcarolina_demographics$CampaignName))

print(unique(southcarolina_demographics$AdName))
```

```{r}
sc_demographics_sports <- southcarolina_demographics %>% 
  mutate(Sport = case_when(
    grepl("FB", CampaignName) ~ "Football",
    grepl("MBB", CampaignName) ~ "Men's Basketball",
    grepl("WBB", CampaignName) ~ "Women's Basketball",
    grepl("BA", CampaignName) ~ "Baseball",
    grepl("B22", CampaignName) ~ "Baseball",
    grepl("B23", CampaignName) ~ "Baseball",
    grepl("Baseball", CampaignName) ~ "Baseball",
    grepl("Women's Basketball", AdName) ~ "Women's Basketball",
    grepl("Men's Basketball", AdName) ~ "Men's Basketball",
    grepl("MBB24", AdName) ~ "Men's Basketball",
    grepl("M24", AdName) | grepl("M24", CampaignName) ~ "Men's Basketball",  # Added CampaignName check
    grepl("W24", AdName) | grepl("W24", CampaignName) ~ "Women's Basketball",  # Added CampaignName check
    grepl("22FB", AdName) | grepl("F22", CampaignName)|grepl("FB22", AdName) ~ "Football",
    grepl("FB23", CampaignName) ~ "Football",
    grepl("FB24", CampaignName) ~ "Football",
    grepl("FB25", CampaignName) ~ "Football",
    grepl("B25", CampaignName) ~ "Baseball",
    TRUE ~ "Unknown"
  ))
```

```{r}
sc_demographics_sports_groups <- sc_demographics_sports %>% 
  filter(Age != "Unknown") %>% 
  filter(Gender!= "unknown") %>% 
  group_by(Age, Gender, Sport) %>% 
  summarise(
    total_reach = sum(Reach, na.rm = TRUE),
    total_impressions = sum(Impressions, na.rm = TRUE),
    total_link_clicks = sum(LinkClicks, na.rm = TRUE),
    total_spend= sum(Spend, na.rm=TRUE)
  ) %>% 
  mutate(CTR = (total_link_clicks / total_impressions) * 100)
```


```{r}
ggplot(sc_demographics_sports_groups, aes(x = Age, y = total_impressions, fill = Gender)) +
  geom_bar(stat = "identity", position = "dodge") +

  theme_minimal() +
  facet_wrap(~ Sport) +
  scale_fill_brewer(palette = "Set1")
```
